results.title: Stories on a train = The Tale of Georgie Grub ...
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. Introduced by Dorothy Butler. The stories are: “Troublesome pig”, ” The Grand old Duke of York”, “Grandma goes shopping”, “Lucky Hans”, “On Friday something funny happened”, “Wolf! Wolf!”, “The Tale of Georgie Grub”, “Everybody said no!”, “Mr. Biff the boxer” and “The Trouble with Jack”.

results.title: Stories at school = Alastair's elephant and nine other stories at school
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. The stories are: Mr. Tick the teacher, Look what I’ve got, Gumdrop: the adventures of a vintage car, Tinker, tailor, soldier, sailor, Sick cow, The House that grew, Alistair’s elephant, Kimi and the watermelon, How St. Francis tamed the wolf, The Bossing of Josie. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Farmyard stories = better move on frog ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers in a farmyard setting and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. The stories are: “Mrs. Mopple’s washing line”, “Sophie and Jack”, “Better move on frog”, “Teddy at the seaside”, “Bookload of animals”, “Mr. Ginger’s potato”, “Wilberforce goes on a picnic”, “Ambo and the little elephant”, “Peter Pipers at the wildlife park”, “Hairy Mclary from Donaldson’s dairy” Introduced by Dorothy Butler.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers in a farmyard setting and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. The stories are: “Mrs. Mopple’s washing line”, “Sophie and Jack”, “Better move on frog”, “Teddy at the seaside”, “Bookload of animals”, “Mr. Ginger’s potato”, “Wilberforce goes on a picnic”, “Ambo and the little elephant”, “Peter Pipers at the wildlife park”, “Hairy Mclary from Donaldson’s dairy” Introduced by Dorothy Butler.
description_for_label:

The stories are: “Mrs. Mopple’s washing line”, “Sophie and Jack”, “Better move on frog”, “Teddy at the seaside”, “Bookload of animals”, “Mr. Ginger’s potato”, “Wilberforce goes on a picnic”, “Ambo and the little elephant”, “Peter Pipers at the wildlife park”, “Hairy Mclary from Donaldson’s dairy” Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Teatime stories = The House that Jack built and nine other teatime stories
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. Stories include Super Adam and Rosie Wonder, Ahhh! said Jack, Apple tree, The House that Jack built, The Smallest turtle, Seaside Christmas tree, Donkey’s tale, Peter Piper’s birthday party, Peepbo!, Wilberforce goes shopping. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Customer Relations in Practice
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: More awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
Emphasises the importance of professional knowledge of an organisation’s stocks or services in dealing with difficult customers. Highlights the customer who parades their knowledge, the silent customer who cannot communicate his needs and the finicky customer who requires every detail. Features John Cleese, Anghared Rees, Patricia Routledge, Bernard Cribbins and Lyn Redgrave. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
John Cleese and Angharad Rees play two sales assistants who demonstrate how to handle awkward customers. Shows the customer in a temper, the compulsive talker and the rude, aggressive and offensive customer. John Barron, June Whitfield and George A. Cooper appear as the awkward customers. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.
